library(shiny)

library(dplyr)
library(readxl)
library(stringr)
library(lubridate)
path = "C:\\Users\\Najwan\\OneDrive\\Desktop\\Datasets\\supermarket_sales - Sheet1.csv"
data <-  read.csv(path)
df <- data.frame(data)

df$sales_date <- NA

# df$sales_date <- format(as.Date(df$Date, format = "%m/%d/%Y"), "%Y-%m-%d")
df$sales_date <- as.Date(df$Date, format = "%m/%d/%Y")
df$Month <- format(df$sales_date, "%B")
df$Month <- as.character(df$Month)

# Assuming your date column is named 'Date'
df <- df[order(df$sales_date), ]  # Sort in ascending order


df <- df %>% select(-c(Date,Time, Branch,Tax.5., City))
sdf <- df %>%
       filter(Customer.type == "Normal") %>%
       group_by(Invoice.ID) %>%
       summarise(count = n())

months.num <- 1:12
months.num <- as.list(months.num)


# Define UI for application that draws a histogram
ui <- fluidPage(
  tags$head(
    tags$style(
      HTML(
        "
      h2 {
        text-align: center;
      }
    "
      )
    )
  ),
  # Application title
  
  titlePanel("Supermarket Sales"),
      # selectInput("page", "Choose a page:", choices = c("Home", "About")),
      # uiOutput("page_ui"),
    
    
    
    
    # verbatimTextOutput("greeting"),
   
    # Sidebar with a slider input for number of bins 
    # sidebarLayout(
    
      fluidRow(
        # sidebarPanel(width = 3,
        # # column(width = 2,
        # # sidebarPanel(width = 4,
        # # fileInput("myfile", "Choose a CSV file", 
        # #           accept = c(".csv")),
        # 
        # sliderInput("bins1",
        #             "Number of bedrooms:",
        #             min = 1,
        #             max = 50,
        #             value = 30),
        #     # verbatimTextOutput("greeting"),
        #     sliderInput("bins2",
        #                 "Number of bins:",
        #                 min = 1,
        #                 max = 50,
        #                 value = 30),
        #     sliderInput("bins3",
        #                 "Number of bins:",
        #                 min = 1,
        #                 max = 50,
        #                 value = 30),
        #     sliderInput("bins4",
        #                 "Number of bins:",
        #                 min = 1,
        #                 max = 50,
        #                 value = 30)
        #   
        # ),
        column(width = 9, tableOutput("preview"))
        
        
        
        ),
  hr(),
  
  fluidRow(
    sidebarPanel(width = 12,
    sliderInput("month_slider", "Select the Month to see the matrix:",
                                 min = unlist(months.num[[1]]),
                                 max = unlist(months.num[[12]]),
                                 value = unlist(months.num[[1]]),
                                 # timeFormat = "%b %Y",  # Display format: Jan 2024
                                 step = 1)
           
    ),
  ),
  
  hr(),
  
  fluidRow(
    column(width = 6,plotOutput("distPlot1")),
    column(width = 6,plotOutput("distPlot2"))
  ),
  
  
  
  
  # tags$head(

        column(width = 6,plotOutput("distPlot3")),
        column(width = 6,plotOutput("distPlot4"))

server <- function(input, output) {
  
  
  # output$page_ui <- renderUI({
  #   switch(input$page,
  #          "Home" = tagList(h2("This is the Home Page"),
  #                           output$distPlot1 <- renderPlot({
  #                             # generate bins based on input$bins from ui.R
  #                             x    <- faithful[, 2]
  #                             bins <- seq(min(x), max(x), length.out = input$bins1 + 1)
  #                             
  #                             # draw the histogram with the specified number of bins
  #                             hist(x, breaks = bins, col = 'orange', border = 'white',
  #                                  xlab = 'Waiting time to next eruption (in mins)',
  #                                  main = 'Histogram of waiting times')
  #                           })),
  #          "About" = tagList(h2("This is the About Page"))
  #   )
  # })
  
    output$preview <- renderTable({

      df$sales_date <- format(as.Date(df$sales_date, format = "%m/%d/%Y"), "%Y-%m-%d")
      head(df, 8)

    })
    
    output$distPlot1 <- renderPlot({
        
      selected_month <- month.name[input$month_slider]
      sd <- df %>% filter(Month == as.character(selected_month))
      
      validate(
        need(nrow(sd) > 0, "No data available for this month.")
      )
      # ggplot(sd, aes(x = Payment, y = Total, fill = Payment)) +
      #   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
      #   theme_minimal() +
      #   labs(title = "Payment Types", y = "Amounts")
      
      # Aggregate total by payment type
      payment_totals <- aggregate(Total ~ Payment, data = sd, sum)
      
      # Set up plot margins
      par(mar = c(5, 5, 4, 2))  # bottom, left, top, right
      
      # Create bar chart
      barplot(payment_totals$Total,
              names.arg = payment_totals$Payment,
              col = rainbow(length(payment_totals$Payment)),  # colorful bars
              main = "Sales through different Payment Types",
              ylab = "Amounts")
      
       
    })
    
    output$distPlot2 <- renderPlot({
      # generate bins based on input$bins from ui.R
      
    
      selected_month <- month.name[input$month_slider]
      sd <- df %>% filter(Month == as.character(selected_month))
      validate(
        need(nrow(sd) > 0, "No data available for this month.")
      )
      sales_by_type <- aggregate(gross.income ~ Customer.type, data = sd, sum)
      
      
      # Plot
      # ggplot(sales_by_type, aes(x = "", y = gross.income, fill = Customer.type)) +
      #   geom_bar(stat = "identity", width = 1) +
      #   coord_polar("y") +
      #   geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Customer.type, "\n$", round(gross.income, 1))),
      #             position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5)) +
      #   ggtitle("Customer Type") +
      #   theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))
        # labs(title = "Customer Type")
      
      
      
      # Create labels with customer type and income
      labels <- paste0(sales_by_type$Customer.type, "\n$", round(sales_by_type$gross.income, 1))
      
      # Create pie chart
      pie(sales_by_type$gross.income,
          labels = labels,
          col = c("violet", "darkred"),  # Customize colors as needed
          main = "Customer Type")
      
    })
    
    output$distPlot3 <- renderPlot({
      
      selected_month <- month.name[input$month_slider]
      sd <- df %>% filter(Month == as.character(selected_month))
      validate(
        need(nrow(sd) > 0, "No data available for this month.")
      )
      
      # ggplot(sd, aes(x = sales_date, y = Total)) +
      #   geom_line(color = "darkgreen", linewidth = 0.9) +
      #   geom_point(color = "navy", size = 2) +
      #   labs(title = "Sales for last year", x = "Date", y = "Sales Amount") +
      # 
      #   # scale_x_date(date_labels = "%b %d, %Y")+
      #   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 0, hjust = 1))
        # theme_minimal()
      # Assuming sd is your data frame with sales_date and Total
      # Convert sales_date to Date class if needed
      sd$sales_date <- as.Date(sd$sales_date)
      
      # Set up plot margins and layout
      par(mar = c(5, 5, 4, 2))  # bottom, left, top, right
      
      # Create the line plot
      plot(sd$sales_date, sd$Total,
           type = "l",                # line plot
           col = "darkgreen",         # line color
           lwd = 0.9,                 # line width
           xlab = "Date",
           ylab = "Sales Amount",
           main = "Sales for last year")
      
      # Add points on top of the line
      points(sd$sales_date, sd$Total,
             col = "navy",
             pch = 16,                # solid circle
             cex = 1.2)               # point size
      
      
  
      
    })
    
    output$distPlot4 <- renderPlot({
      selected_month <- month.name[input$month_slider]
      sd <- df %>% filter(Month == as.character(selected_month))
      validate(
        need(nrow(sd) > 0, "No data available for this month.")
      )
      rating <- sd %>% group_by(Product.line) %>% summarise(avg_rating = mean(Rating, na.rm = TRUE))
      
      par(mar = c(5, 8, 4, 2))  # More space on left (bottom, left, top, right)
      
      bar_pos <- barplot(rating$avg_rating,
                         names.arg = FALSE,   # Weâ€™ll manually draw y labels
                         horiz = TRUE,
                         col = "lightgreen",
                         xlab = "Average Rating",
                         main = "Average Rating for each Product Line",
                         xaxt = "n",  # Suppress axis ticks
                         yaxt = "n")
      
      # Add y-axis labels (left-end)
      text(x = par("usr")[1] + 0.2,  # Place near the left edge of plot
           y = bar_pos,
           labels = rating$Product.line,
           adj = 0,  # Left-align
           cex = 0.9)
      
      # Add value labels on the bars
      text(x = rating$avg_rating -0.9,  # Just past bar end
           y = bar_pos,
           labels = round(rating$avg_rating, 2),
           adj = 0,
           cex = 0.9,
           col = "black")
    })
    
    
    
}

# Run the application 
shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)
